alert.note: Alert for Northern Berkshire; Southern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 15 at 4:09AM EDT until May 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN CONNECTICUT AND WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS... The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Wednesday evening. * Affected Area...In Connecticut, Litchfield County. In Massachusetts, Berkshire County. * Timing...Tuesday and Wednesday, with the most critical conditions between late morning and sunset each day. * Winds...On Tuesday, west-southwest at 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. On Wednesday, northwest at 10 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...On Tuesday and Wednesday, as low as 20 percent. * Temperatures...On Tuesday, in the upper 60s to 70s. On Wednesday, in the upper 40s to 50s. * Lightning...None. * Impacts...Dry conditions and gusty winds may result in rapid fire spread if ignition occurs.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
